p:
The present study demonstrated the physicochemical properties and antioxidant activity of Gsp through examining sulfhydryl, disulfide bonds, amino acid composition, degree of hydrolysis, oil and water absorption capacity, emulsifiability, and foaming capacity, and assessing radical scavenging activity (DPPH, ABTS,
O 2 −
˙, and ˙OH), reducing power, and inhibition rate of lipid peroxidation. Additionally, the cytoprotective effect of Gsp on HL‐7702 cells exposed in food injurant BaP was also examined. This study provided a fundamental basis for substantiating dietary of Gsp used for resistance to oxidation and hepatic injury.
